intro: Cuphea purpusii, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that resemble firecrackers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Cuphea purpusii is also valued for its ability to attract hummingbirds and other pollinators.
